name: New York City
overviewText:
New York City is a vibrant metropolis that never sleeps, offering an unparalleled blend of culture, cuisine, and iconic landmarks.

From world-class museums like MoMA and the Met to diverse neighborhoods filled with authentic international cuisine, NYC has something for every taste. Explore the trendy streets of Williamsburg, savor authentic ramen in the East Village, or indulge in exclusive dining experiences through the Dorsia app.

Whether you're catching a show in Midtown, exploring the artistic enclaves of the Lower East Side, or enjoying the waterfront views in Long Island City, New York City promises unforgettable experiences at every corner.

recommendations.title: Koreatown (Ktown)
recommendations.description: Authentic Korean BBQ and cuisine with late-night dining, karaoke, and vibrant atmosphere in Midtown Manhattan.

recommendations.title: Williamsburg, Brooklyn
recommendations.description: Trendy cafes, artisanal shops, waterfront views, and vibrant nightlife scene in Brooklyn's hippest neighborhood.

recommendations.title: East Village
recommendations.description: Diverse Asian cuisine from Japanese ramen to Vietnamese pho, plus iconic NYC bars and bohemian culture.

recommendations.title: World-Class Museums
recommendations.description: Visit MoMA for modern art, the Met for classical masterpieces, and the Museum of Natural History for science exhibits.

activities.name: Day Trips
highlights: Big Snow - Indoor skiing in New Jersey
Fort Lee - Korean suburb in New Jersey

activities.name: Other Activities
highlights: Ferry to see the Statue of Liberty
US Open: day pass, food and novelty us open drinks souvenir cup

locations.blurb: Hidden izakaya in Midtown with extensive sake selection.

suburbs.blurb: Queens neighborhood with diverse dining and bars

suburbs.blurb: Manhattan's Korean neighborhood with authentic cuisine and nightlife

suburbs.blurb: Manhattan's Chinatown with authentic Chinese and Vietnamese cuisine

suburbs.name: Williamsburg
suburbs.blurb: Brooklyn's trendy neighborhood with cafes, restaurants, and nightlife

locations.name: Domino Park
locations.blurb: Waterfront park with views of Manhattan.

locations.name: Spikeball
locations.blurb: Social spikeball games. Follow @nycroundnets on Instagram.

suburbs.name: Flushing, Queens
suburbs.blurb: Asian enclave with authentic Chinese, Korean, and Asian cuisine

tips.heading: Dorsia App
tips.details: Use the Dorsia app to access exclusive restaurant reservations at premium dining spots like Carbone Privato. Book well in advance for the best experiences.

tips.heading: Public Transportation
tips.details: NYC's subway system is the most efficient way to get around. Purchase a MetroCard or use contactless payment (Apple Pay, Google Pay) for easy access. Consider getting an unlimited weekly pass if staying for an extended period.

tips.heading: Neighborhoods to Explore
tips.details: Each NYC neighborhood has its own character. Williamsburg is trendy and artistic, Ktown offers authentic Korean experiences, East Village has diverse Asian cuisine, and Flushing in Queens has the most authentic Chinese food outside of China.

tips.heading: Reservations
tips.details: Popular restaurants fill up quickly, especially on weekends. Make reservations well in advance, particularly for omakase experiences and upscale dining.
